links.*: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==February==
* '''[[4 February|4]]''' - [[C.S. Lewis]] writes to lifelong friend Arthur Greeves on ''[[The Hobbit]]'', saying "''Since term began [on January 15] I have had a delightful time reading a children's story which Tolkien has just written . . . Whether it is really good (I think it is until the end) is of course another question: still more, whether it will succeed with modern children''" (''They Stand Together'', collected letters from Lewis to Greeves, ed. [[wikipedia:Walter Hooper|Walter Hooper]], No. 183).
* '''[[24 February|24]]''' - [[Verlyn Flieger]] is born.
==March==
*'''[[16 March|16]]''' - Tolkien writes a [[Letter to Kenneth Sisam (16 March 1933)|letter to Kenneth Sisam]].

==April==
* '''[[5 April|5]]''' - Actor [[Noel Appleby]] is born.

==September==
* '''?''' - Tolkien visits [[Sarehole]], the place of his childhood, and laments the changes he observed.<ref>{{HM|Bio}}, pp. 124-5</ref>

==November==
* '''[[9 November|9]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s poem "[[Errantry]]" is published in ''The Oxford Magazine''.
==December==
* '''[[2 December|2]]''' - [[Father Christmas]] writes a [[Letters from Father Christmas|letter]] to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s children.
* '''[[21 December|21]]''' - Father Christmas writes a [[Letters from Father Christmas|letter]] to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s children.
* '''[[21 December|21]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to R.W. Chambers|a letter to R.W. Chambers]].
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] gives a decorated manuscript containing the poem "[[Visio de Doworst]]" to his friend [[R.W. Chambers]].
==?==
* '''?''' - ''[[The Saga of Hrolf Kraki]]'', translated by [[Stella M. Mills]] and dedicated to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]],  is published.
* '''?''' - [[Michael McStay]], who would voice [[Ceorl]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|the 1981 radio series]], is born in Essex, England.
* '''?''' - [[Bernie Zuber]], author and artist, is born.
